*

hu

Nov 12, 2013

 The horses kicked violently in the darkness.  Furiously pounding hooves before a stormy canvas. The winds rose, the horses screamed. “Give me the candy.” Montano looked away from the horses in the distance. Zaphen leered at him before grabbing his Oh Henry! candy bars. “Those are…” Montano stopped. The look of madness in Zaphen’s eyes said too much. Prisoners of an insane institution. Montano looked at the horses. Their acrobatics were beautiful and terrifying against the lightning. A thin blade across the neck. A spilling.
